alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 13 at 7:07PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL POCAHONTAS COUNTY... At 707 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Pocahontas, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Pocahontas County, including the following locations... Pocahontas Municipal Airport. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
